name: Arcane Speedarcher: Monk 6/ Wizard 13/ Arcane Archer 21
author: Mick Dagger

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
This lightning-fast warrior is the ultimate run and gun archer. Fuelled with magic he zooms around at tremendous speed and lands his arrows with deadly precision.
He can spot most creatures and masters stealth for strategic positioning.
He can craft and set deadly traps to supplement his archery tactics with other damage types and improved crowd control.
And he has wizard spells to further improve crowd control, attack and defence.

The Monk Speed feat removes the 50% cap and allows for immensely stacking speed effects from combinations of the spells Expeditious Retreat and Mass Haste and the Haste item property.

Special:
The Monk Speed feat removes the 50% cap and allows for immensely stacking speed effects from combinations of the spells Expeditious Retreat and Mass Haste and the Haste item property. Extended ER and MH last 26 rounds.
The character has access to all AA special attacks. The arrows pierce +11 damage reduction.
Lvl 7 arcane spellcasting adds versatility to combat tactics and offers several spells for improved crowd control, attack and defense. 
Necromancy was chosen because I felt it would be easy to live without the Divination school for this character.

Strengths:
Extremely fast
Very high AB
Crafts and sets deadly traps
Stealth
High Spot skill
Versatility with several tactical options: Speed, traps, spells, stealth, AA special attacks.
Evasion and very high reflex saves. 

Weaknesses:
Low hitpoints
No Uncanny dodge
13 caster levels can be dispelled

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
If I'm not wrong, Blinding speed uses a Haste script, lvl 10 for the vanilla version. If that is the case, that feat will only give you regular haste speed. Try stacking Mass haste and/or Expeditious retreat and see the difference!
If this is your first archer build, I will recommend my arcane archer guide, especially the tactics part.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
I still love this build and especially the access to sweet monk gear without having UMD, which is a rarity.

But after looking closer at your recommended environments I must disagree with your choice. 

Low magic realms typically nerf AA by limiting AB boosts to +1 every 4 levels like a WM and by applying piercing resistance copiously among creature blueprints (and greater archer belts).  Yet other low-magic ban AA entirely.  However, even on the highest magic environments, an unmodified AA can wreak havoc like no other class.  Besides the ability to penetrate nearly every DR, there are commonly insane ammo properties that make high-APR ranged attacks irresistable even with elevated pierce resistance and without needing to engage DevCrit range.  When in doubt, I always try out an AA on new high magic worlds to test the AC caps, damage resistances, unspecified custom auras and opposing spell proficiencies with relative impunity.

This is not only an Arcane Speedarcher, it's a Stealth Speedarcher with Stunning Fist should the situation arise.  Watch out for this one!  Just nasty.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
Welcome back, Hip!
This build has 6 levels of Monk, which gives you Knockdown and IKD. The player needs to be cautioned that while a knocked-down enemy is easier to hit with a melee attack, it is actually harder to hit with an ranged attack.
